context.title: Context & Mission
context.subtitle: Project mission and stakes
context.description1: I am currently carrying out a 15+ week internship at ANI & Low-Tech in Dijon, France, starting from January 12, 2026. ANI & Low-Tech is an organization dedicated to accessible technology and digital innovation with a focus on sustainability and inclusivity.
context.description2: My mission encompasses technical assistance at CROUS BFC (the university services center), integration into the ANI & Low-Tech service environment, and the development of a local AI solution tailored to the organization's needs.
context.objective1Desc: Provide assistance to CROUS BFC users
context.objective3Desc: Create a local AI tailored to organizational needs
context.objective4Title: Make the FabLab more accessible to everyone
context.objective4Desc: Re-work the tools of the immersion room and the OpenLab

role.title: My Role
role.subtitle: Responsibilities & tasks
role.description: Throughout this internship, I am developing a comprehensive understanding of the organization while contributing to multiple technical initiatives and support functions.
role.responsibility1Desc: Provide support to CROUS BFC and ANI & Low-Tech users, resolving technical issues and optimizing workflows.
role.responsibility2Desc: Design and implement a local AI solution that meets the organization's specific requirements without relying on external cloud services.
role.responsibility3Desc: Learn the organization's processes and integrate seamlessly into the ANI & Low-Tech team.

hero.title: Euphron
hero.location: Learning Centre Claude Oytana • Besançon, France

context.title: Context & Objectives
context.subtitle: Project mission and stakes
context.description1: I had the opportunity to work as a web full-stack intern at the Learning Centre Claude Oytana in Besançon, France, from April 2025 to May 2025. My mission was to create a mobile application called 'Euphron', enabling students at the Université de Franche-Comté to give or take second-hand sports equipment on a donation system.
context.description2: The creation of this application was proposed by STAPS students, following a market study on access to sports equipment in their curriculum. This study revealed that, while some schools manage to provide the necessary equipment to their students, in many others, students themselves must finance their equipment.
context.constraintText: No monetary gain allowed - everything had to be free, based on student solidarity.

role.title: My Role
role.subtitle: Responsibilities & autonomous development
role.description: I was tasked with creating the entire web application (computer and mobile compatible) completely autonomously.
role.responsibility1Desc: Design on Figma for client validation

organization.title: Organization
organization.subtitle: Planning & methodology
organization.methodologyDesc: Weekly meetings with the library team and my internship supervisor. Using Git for versioning and Trello for task management.

techStack.title: Tech Stack
techStack.subtitle: Technologies & architecture
techStack.justificationDesc: I favored Vue.js because I master this framework well, unlike Angular or React. Quasar was the ideal choice for native mobile compatibility, perfectly meeting the project requirements.

features.title: Features
features.subtitle: Development & implementation
features.highlightDesc: Developing the real-time chat with Socket.IO was a first for me. The excellent documentation allowed me to quickly understand the concepts and successfully implement this feature.

architecture.title: Architecture
architecture.subtitle: Technical structure & data flow
architecture.diagramCaption: Diagram of the communication flow between the frontend (Vue/Quasar) and the backend (Express, Socket.io, MySQL).
architecture.description: The application architecture is based on a clear separation between the frontend, developed with Quasar/Vue.js, and the backend, built around Express, Socket.io and MySQL.
architecture.section1Desc: When a user interacts with the interface via their browser, their actions are handled by Vue components, which orchestrate the display and logic of the application. These components, when they need to access data or trigger server-side operations, call on dedicated JavaScript services.
architecture.section2Desc: In parallel with this traditional operation, the application also integrates a real-time dimension thanks to Socket.io. For features like chat or instant notifications, Vue components communicate with the server via the Socket.io client.

security.title: Security
security.subtitle: Protection & best practices
security.intro: During development, I learned the importance of securing against SQL injections. I implemented double protection:
security.method1Desc: This frontend method checks that the user is not trying to harm the application's operation using a regular expression. This expression verifies that fields (name, email, phone) do not contain suspicious characters like ' " ; -- / * , etc.
security.method2Desc: Prepared (or parameterized) queries offer robust protection because they:
security.method2Item2: Are supported by all modern SQL engines
security.method2Item3: Form the basis of all modern ORMs

learning.title: Learning
learning.subtitle: Skills & feedback
learning.technical2: Deepening web security (SQL injections, prepared queries)
learning.soft1: Autonomy in managing a complete project
learning.reflectionTitle: If I had to do it again
learning.reflectionDesc: I would have preferred working in a team for more efficiency. Being alone, I couldn't implement as many features as desired, although it allowed me to develop my autonomy and ability to manage a project in its entirety.
